items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Tidal conditions are expected to improve and no flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Further rainfall is forecast but no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

floodArea.county: East Riding of Yorkshire, North Yorkshire, York

items.message: High river levels today may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible on Thursday 27 November 2025 and on Friday 28 November 2025. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers, especially around Stamford Bridge, Pocklington, Wressle, Wilberfoss and Elvington. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 08:00AM on 28 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message: High river levels today may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible on Thursday 27 November 2025 and on Friday 28 November 2025. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers, particularly around the Low Marishes and Malton area. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 08:00AM on 28 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

Rising river levels today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 27 November 2025 . This is expected to peak between 2:00PM and 3:00PM. 
Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. 
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and closely monitoring the situation. 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 28 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water
items.message:
Rising river levels today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 27 November 2025 from midday. 
Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. 
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and closely monitoring the situation. 
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. 
This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 28 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

High river levels are expected to cause flooding today. River levels are slowly falling and expected to drop over the coming days. Flooding is expected to continue on Thursday 27 November 2025 and on Friday 28 November 2025. Locations most affected will be Buttercrambe Mill at Buttercrambe Bridge. We are closely monitoring the situation. Start acting on your flood plan if you have one. This message will be updated by 08:00AM on 28 November 2025 or as the situation changes.
